sentences.literal: Chen Sheng was a man from Yangcheng. His courtesy name was She.
Wu Guang was a man from Yangxia. His courtesy name was Shu.

sentences.chinese: 二世元年七月，發閭左適戍漁陽，九百人屯大澤鄉。
sentences.literal: In the seventh month of the first year of the Second Generation, they conscripted commoners to go garrison Yuyang. Nine hundred men were camped at Daze Township.

sentences.chinese: 陳勝、吳廣皆次當行，為屯長。
sentences.literal: Chen Sheng and Wu Guang were both next in line to go, so they became the camp chiefs.

sentences.chinese: 會天大雨，道不通，度已失期。
sentences.literal: They encountered great rains, the roads became impassable, and they estimated they had already missed their deadline.
Missing the deadline meant execution by law for all of them.

sentences.chinese: 吾聞二世少子也，不當立，當立者乃公子扶蘇。
sentences.literal: I have heard that the Second Generation is the younger son and should not have been established. The one who should have been established is the young lord Fu Su.'

sentences.chinese: 扶蘇以數諫故，上使外將兵。
sentences.literal: Because Fu Su repeatedly remonstrated, the emperor sent him outside to lead troops.'
Now some have heard he was killed without crime by the Second Generation.'

sentences.chinese: 百姓多聞其賢，未知其死也。
sentences.literal: The common people have heard much of his worthiness, but do not know he is dead.'

sentences.chinese: 項燕為楚將，數有功，愛士卒，楚人憐之。
sentences.literal: Xiang Yan was a Chu general who repeatedly achieved merit and loved his officers and soldiers. The Chu people pitied him.'
Some think he is dead, some think he has fled.'
Wu Guang thought this was right.
